Description:
The system should be capable enough to hire multiple freelancers on a task.

*Currently in the system,* once a freelancer has been hired the status of the task changes to hired and no other freelancer can send a proposal on it as the job post is not available on the Client request page.

*Modification:*
We have to make the system viable enough to accommodate multiple freelancers on a single skill.

* Think of a job posting page as a poster it has no link with the other than hiring a freelancer from the proposal so that they can know that upon a particular skill, multiple tasks have been assigned to multiple freelancers.
* As soon as the job is posted and is reflected on the Client request page, the freelancers can send proposals on it by putting the details required on the form to apply.
* The proposals are reviewed by the client in the proposal tab. The client can hire and withdraw. 
* Once the proposal is accepted by the client, the freelancer gets hired and the task is created. However the job post from the client request page will not be removed, so more freelancers can be hired.
* When a Client hires multiple freelancers on a particular skill, for each hiring, a task will be created from that task client can go to single task management pages.
* on the Client request page, it should show how many proposals are already sent to a job post.
* on the job posting page, clients and freelancers should be able to see the count of how many freelancers are hired.
* The total estimated budget will remain the same on the job posting page.

*Direct hiring;*

If a freelancer is directly hired a workspace is created. and a task is assigned.

*Custom hiring:*
If a freelancer is hired through custom hire, a workspace is created and a task is assigned.

*In both the above cases, every workspace that is created whether direct hiring or custom hiring should be available in the dropdown while Direct hiring or Custom hiring, so that a single workspace could include freelancers hired directly and freelancers hired from custom hiring.*

*Moreover, in the same workspace, it should have the option to add skills that would be displayed on the client request page to hire multiple freelancers from proposals.*


To stop the process of hiring from the proposals upon a particular skill, the skill will be made inactive. so that skill will not be shown on the client request page, whether the tasks which are linked to that skill are in process or not.

There are 4 total levels for Nynx freelancers and have different criteria to meet.



# *New Expert*

When a user will sign in as an expert they will be on a level of New Expert. To achieve further levels, they would have to achieve the following criteria. 

*2. Novice*

* Created 1 active skill-set minimum

* Created 1 active skill-set minimum

* Earn £2500 or more

* Created 1 active skill-set minimum
* Complete at least 60 tasks with 98% min rating.
* Earn £5000 or more.

the bell icon should show the total of unread notifications.

if the time is over the counter will go in negative whenever the delivery is sent. that delayed time will be shown in the task tab and the Feedback and delivery tab.

the bell icon should show the total of unread notifications.

The search engine needs to be developed for NYNX.

The following requirements should be followed to search for jobs:
*Before login:*
The user should be able to search for jobs based on keywords, categories, or skills.

if a user types any keyword, the system will display the client request page with the latest job first algorithm. 

*After login:*
The search for jobs will only be available for freelancers, Sellers can search for jobs by typing any keyword, category, subcategory, or skill.

The system fetches the results from the client request page based on the latest job first.

There will be the following filters available to the freelancer:

*Category and Sub-category*

Freelancer filter out the job on Category and subcategory. it will be a dropdown menu. If a user has selected a certain category, the subcategories against it will automatically be listed in another dropdown and the user can further select a subcategory to refine the results.

*Adhoc and Monthly :*

The filter for Adhoc and monthly. if Adhoc is selected it will list all the jobs which have Adhoc tasks in them. and if monthly is selected it will list all the jobs which have monthly-based tasks in it.

*The Price Range filter:*

The Price range can be entered by the user. which will refine the search result further based on the range selected.

The user will have to put their payment methods and billing address while setting up their profile, from the profile setting page.

The buyer will be redirected to checkout in the following scenarios

# If a freelancer is hired directly.
# If the freelancer's proposal is accepted.
# Through custom chat.

In all above, the system will take the buyer to the checkout page.

On the checkout page, the buyer will add the billing method.

Buyer can review the order summary which will list the following:

# Tier Price
# Delivery time
# subtotal
# Service fee
# Total 

At the bottom of page there will be a button for “confirm and pay”

On clicking it the amount will be deducted from the buyer's account and will be locked into the stripe/PayPal wallet.

The wallet will release the money when the freelancer task is completed and transfer it to the seller's account. Further, freelancers will be able to withdraw that amount.

Right after the checkout is done requirements form will appear, where all the requirements asked by the freelancer on their gig will be listed and the buyer has to provide them.

Please review the Figma design for the reference
[https://www.figma.com/file/zfL03LVPc2MXyFG4kAP1Sx/NYNX-Website-New?node-id=580%3A567&t=Ky6NQZsUmnM6TlTR-0|https://www.figma.com/file/zfL03LVPc2MXyFG4kAP1Sx/NYNX-Website-New?node-id=580%3A567&t=Ky6NQZsUmnM6TlTR-0|smart-link]

As there are 3 ways the client can proceed to the checkout,

# Through Proposal.
# Custom Offer. 
Before a freelancer is hired the buyer would have to go through checkout. Checkout will offer 3 methods PayPal, stripe, and Visa card.

Summary: Creating activity tab for Buyer and Seller (Backend)
Description:
*The activity tab for seller*s *and buyers will be available in their respective workspaces.*

*Features :*

In the Activity tab freelancer will be able to communicate in real-time with other teammates which are added to the same workspace.

Summary: Developing inbox for seller and buyer(Backend).
Description:
|h1. +*1.Creating Inbox for client.*+
The client/buyer will have a real-time chat option in the side bar.
On clicking the Chat icon, their inbox will appear.
*Inbox:*
In the inbox on left half users will be displayed with whom client have recently chatted or in process.
Client will have a search bar from where they can search for the user from the system based on their username.
If a certain user is selected their chat will be appear on the right half on the inbox page.
At the bottom of the page client will have input field to type message, attachments can be added from the button and message will be sent on clicking the send button.
Furthermore, the last seen of the recipient will also be indicated on top of the page.
*Custom Offer:*
Client will receive a custom offer from the freelancer.
Which will be listing following:
·         Description of the offer.
·         Added files.
·         Freelancer Gig
·         Budget and time.
Besides that client can also withdraw the offer from the “*Withdraw Offer*” button.
*Accepting the offer:*
On clicking the offer from the inbox popup will appear.
The popup will display the name of sender on top.
Below that client will have an option to select the workspace from the dropdown or can create a new one.
Once workspace is selected, Client can also view the gig details of freelancer along with the attached documents. 
To accept the offer client will have to click the “Accept” button.
Once accepted the freelancer will be added to the workspace and the task will be displayed in workspace of both freelancer and buyer.
h1. *2.* +*Creating Inbox for freelancer:*+
The Freelancer will have a real-time chat option in the side bar.
On clicking the Chat icon, their inbox will appear.
*Inbox:*
In the inbox on left half users will be displayed with whom freelancer have recently chatted or in process.
Seller will have a search bar from where they can search for the user from the system based on their username.
If a certain user is selected their chat will be appear on the right half on the inbox page.
At the bottom of the page freelancer will have input field to type message, attachments can be added from the button and message will be sent on clicking the send button.
Furthermore, the last seen of the recipient will also be indicated on top of the page.
*Custom Offer:*
Freelancer will send a custom offer to the client.
To create an offer freelancer will click on the “send offer” button.
Which will open a create offer form in that form following fields will be asked to fill:
*Select Gig:*
 
It will be a dropdown listing all gigs of freelancer.
*Description:*
 
From where seller will add the offer description.
*Choose you Budget:*
 
Project Budget and Monthly based.
# Adding days and months.
# Adding file.
To send the freelancer has to click on the *“Send offer”* button from the top of the form.
And cancel button bring user back to inbox.
*Accepting the offer:*
If the offer is accepted by the client then that seller will be able to see the task in the workspace he/she got added.|

Summary: Single Task management (Seller and buyer ) Backend
Description:
*In the single task management screen following tabs are included.*

# Requirements
# Details 
# Delivery and feedback

*For Buyer:*

* In a requirement tab,  buyers will be able to view the uploaded files and the description against each question asked by the freelancer in the GIG.

!Workspace - Details (1)-20221017-124308 (d009c82e-5565-4e54-9187-78d5fb17af95).jpg|width=2880,height=2070!

* In the details tab buyer will be able to see the order details which include.

# Order Number
# Revisions 
# Special Offer
# Subtotal
# Service Fee
# Refund
# Tip
# Total

there will be a dropdown menu in which buyer will have the option to cancel the contract. 

!Workspace - Details (2)-20221017-125749.jpg|width=2881,height=2070!

* Buyer will be able to see refund and Change budget requests from the freelancer on the details page.
buyer could accept or reject any request. the design for the request is as follows.

!Workspace - Details (3)-20221017-130255.jpg|width=54.82968369829684%!
* In the deliverable and feedback tab client will be able to accept a particular delivery or request revision to it. 

# If a delivery is accepted then the task status will be changed to complete.
# if a revision request is generated then the task status will be in revision. 
# To request a revision client click on the request revision button as shown in the below figure.


!Workspace - Details (4)-20221017-130958.jpg|width=2880,height=2436!

On clicking the button a pop will appear which will have the following inputs.

Attach file and Description. As shown in the below figure.

!Workspace - Details (5)-20221017-131224.jpg|width=2880,height=2070!

* The client will be able to provide feedback and provide tips on clicking the accept button on a particular task as shown in the below image.

!Workspace - Feedback-20221017-131424 (288666f8-82cf-45f6-a078-c94efd99fab2).jpg|width=2880,height=2070!

*For Freelancer:*


* In Requirments, tab freelancer will be able to see the uploaded files by the client to his asked questions. as shown in the fig below.

!Workspace - Details (1)-20221017-124308.jpg|width=2880,height=2070!

* In the details tab freelancer will be able to see the order details which includes

# Order Number
# Revisions 
# Special Offer
# Subtotal
# Service Fee
# Refund
# Tip
# Total

There will be a dropdown menu in which freelancers will have the following options.



# Change budget and Time
# Refund
# Cancel Contract

*Change budget and time:*
on clicking change budget and time a pop will appear for the freelancer showing the previous budget and new budget along with the delivery date. 

Freelancers will have the field to add budget and days. As shown in the image below

!Workspace - Details (6)-20221017-132404.jpg|width=2880,height=2070!

The request for a change budget will appear in the details tab for the client, which can be accepted or rejected. The change in budget will be counted as a Special offer.

*Refund:*

Freelancers will be able to refund a certain amount to the client. a pop will appear which will be showing the previous and New budgets after the refund. The seller will add the refund amount in the input field at the bottom.

The buyer will receive a notification for a refund on his details tab. which can be accepted or rejected. 

!Workspace - Details (7)-20221017-133149.jpg|width=2880,height=2070!

* In the Delivery and feedback tab client will be able to send the delivery to the particular task through deliver files button.

On clicking the button a pop-up will appear which will be asking for the delivery file attachment and description, As shown in the image below

!Workspace - Details (8)-20221017-133242.jpg|width=2880,height=2070!

Further freelancers will also be able to provide feedback to the client if the delivery is accepted from the popup shown below (Excluding Tips).


!Workspace - Feedback-20221017-131424.jpg|width=2880,height=2070!

Summary: Single task Management for Buyer and Seller.
Description:
Single task Management module involves following functionalities.

For Buyer :

On clicking a particular task from the tasks tab in workspace a screen will appear with following Tabs.

# Requirements.
Buyer will provide the requirements asked by the hired freelancer and the file uploaded by the buyer will be displayed in the requirement tab against each question with the description. 
# Details. 
Buyer will be able to see details of his order.
# Delivery & Feedback.
client will be able to to accept or send revision for the task deliverable , if the deliverable is accepted then buyer will provide the feedback.

# Workspace and job posting should be done from 1 page.
# On the Job posting, If we select a monthly budget the delivery input field should get month instead of days.
# If we select a fixed budget(Adhoc) the delivery input field should get days. If days are less than 30 then it should be shown as days and if days are greater than 30 then it should be shown as months with days.
# In direct hiring, one field should be added for the workspace.

*The seller will be able to view the workspaces which are assigned to him.*

In the workspace tab following fields will be displayed.

·         Workspace title

·         Budgets

·         Progress status

·         Time.

There will be a filter on the top of the page that will filter out the Tasks in a workspace based on

·         In progress

·         In revision

·         Completed

·         Canceled


!Workspace-20221014-101543.jpg|width=2880,height=2071!

*After clicking on a certain workspace title in the workspace tab, the detail page will appear with following tabs*.

#  Job posting
# Freelancers
# Details
# Activity
# Deliverable

·         The layout of the detail page must be according to the FIGMA design provided.

·         On top of the page, the workspace title should be displayed. With the status.

·         If there is a job open or not completed the “In progress” status will be displayed.

·         Below the workspace title the budget of the project will appear divided into the following fields.

# Estimated budget

# In Escrow

# Tasks paid

# Remaining

# Total payments.

The profile icon for all of the freelancers hired in that workspace will appear.

*On the workspace detail page*, *all of the jobs will be displayed under the Job Posting Tab.*

The job posting will be having following fields.

·         Job posting title will be fetched from the client workspace.

·         Budget timeline for the job based on the tasks completed.

·         Skill on which the freelancers are hired.

·         Description

·         Attached Document

!Workspace - Job posting (1)-20221014-101730.jpg|width=2880,height=4133!



*The freelancer tab will involve 2 sub*-*tabs which are below:*

·         *Team:*

In the team tab freelancer or sellers will be able to see their fellow freelancers' profiles and will be able to message them.

·         *Submitted Proposal:*

In this tab, all the tasks on which the seller has submitted proposals will be listed along with the status of approval or not.

*The details tab will be listing all the tasks assigned to the freelancer in the opened workspace with its details.*

The fields involved are below:

*Tasks:*

Displaying task name

*Budget:*

The budget of the task will be displayed based on the Ad hoc or Monthly

*Time:*

Time spent on that task or the due time of the task.

*Status:*

The working status of the task can be (in progress, completed, in revised)

*Earned:*

The amount earned by the freelancer on the particular task.

!Workspace - Details-20221014-102907.jpg|width=2880,height=2071!

*The next tab will be Activity.*

In this tab, all the freelancers will be able to collaborate with other teammates by sharing messages and the required attachments.

*The deliverable tab will list all the deliverables.*

·         In this tab, the freelancer will be able to upload the delivery file for the tasks.

·         The deliverable tab will have an upload button to upload the file.

All the deliverables will be shared to the client and will appear to the client on his workspace.

*The seller will be able to view the workspaces which are assigned to him.*

In the workspace tab following fields will be displayed.

·         Workspace title

·         Budgets

·         Progress status

·         Time.

There will be a filter on the top of the page that will filter out the Tasks in a workspace based on

·         In progress

·         In revision

·         Completed

·         Canceled


!Workspace-20221014-101543.jpg|width=2880,height=2071!

*After clicking on a certain workspace title in the workspace tab, the detail page will appear with following tabs*.

#  Job posting
# Freelancers
# Details
# Activity
# Deliverable

·         The layout of the detail page must be according to the FIGMA design provided.

·         On top of the page, the workspace title should be displayed. With the status.

·         If there is a job open or not completed the “In progress” status will be displayed.

·         Below the workspace title the budget of the project will appear divided into the following fields.

# Estimated budget

# In Escrow

# Tasks paid

# Remaining

# Total payments.

The profile icon for all of the freelancers hired in that workspace will appear.

*On the workspace detail page*, *all of the jobs will be displayed under the Job Posting Tab.*

The job posting will be having following fields.

·         Job posting title will be fetched from the client workspace.

·         Budget timeline for the job based on the tasks completed.

·         Skill on which the freelancers are hired.

·         Description

·         Attached Document

!Workspace - Job posting (1)-20221014-101730.jpg|width=2880,height=4133!



*The freelancer tab will involve 2 sub*-*tabs which are below:*

·         *Team:*

In the team tab freelancer or sellers will be able to see their fellow freelancers' profiles and will be able to message them.

·         *Submitted Proposal:*

In this tab, all the tasks on which the seller has submitted proposals will be listed along with the status of approval or not.

*The details tab will be listing all the tasks assigned to the freelancer in the opened workspace with its details.*

The fields involved are below:

*Tasks:*

Displaying task name

*Budget:*

The budget of the task will be displayed based on the Ad hoc or Monthly

*Time:*

Time spent on that task or the due time of the task.

*Status:*

The working status of the task can be (in progress, completed, in revised)

*Earned:*

The amount earned by the freelancer on the particular task.

!Workspace - Details-20221014-102907.jpg|width=2880,height=2071!

*The next tab will be Activity.*

In this tab, all the freelancers will be able to collaborate with other teammates by sharing messages and the required attachments.

*The deliverable tab will list all the deliverables.*

·         In this tab, the freelancer will be able to upload the delivery file for the tasks.

·         The deliverable tab will have an upload button to upload the file.

All the deliverables will be shared to the client and will appear to the client on his workspace.

After client has hired a freelancer for a particular task , the freelancer will be added to the workspace in which that client has posted that job.

Freelancer will be able to see all the workspaces which is assigned to him along with the following tabs.
# Job posting
# Freelancers
# Details 
# Activity 
# Deliverables

For design take reference from the Fimga attached.

Summary: Freelancer on boarding through GIGs detail page and buyer request page.
Description:
There are 2 ways through which a freelancer can be onboarded 
# Through the GiG view page. 
# Through buyer request page.

*Through GiG view page* 
The client or buyer can search for the freelancer's GiG and then hire him on the particular skill by sending the offer and that hired freelancer will be added to the workspace under which that job/skill was posted.

*Through Buyer request page*
On the buyer request page freelancer will be able to search for all the jobs related to his gigs with the help of keywords and the jobs for which the client has requested his services will be viewed upon which the freelancer can accept the job and send the proposal to the client.

Buyer will be able to create a workspace from the form which will be having following input fields:
•	Workspace title
•	Skills
•	Description 
A post and cancel button will be provided at the bottom right end of the form

!image-2022-09-02-18-38-00-723.png|width=200,height=183!

 
Skills:
To add skills in the workspace form there is b button named “Add skill” which will open a skilled form.
Following input fields will be required:
•	Choose a skill :
Which will be a search bar.
•	Skill drop-down menu
•	Category dropdown menu
•	Specialization
•	Choose your budget:
The project budget will be selected from 2 options Ad hoc or monthly based.
The client will also provide a max budget for the project along with the delivery days. 
There will be 2 buttons cancel and save in the top right corner of the form.
Skills are added after clicking on the save button.

!image-2022-09-02-18-38-50-573.png|width=200,height=183!

 
*
Posting job in the workspace.*
After clicking on a certain workspace from the dashboard or workspace tab.
The work space will open with all the jobs posted in it.
There will be a button to post new jobs named “post a job” Job posting form will open.

*After clicking on the Post a job Button.*
Buyer will be able to post a job in the current workspace from the form which will be having following input fields:
•	Workspace title to top.
•	Job post Title
•	Skills
•	Description 
A post and cancel button will be provided at the bottom right end of the form.

Skills:
To add skills for the job there is b button named “Add skill” which will open a skill form.
Following input fields will be required:
•	Choose a skill :
Which will be a search bar.
•	Skill drop-down menu
•	Category dropdown menu
•	Specialization
•	Choose your budget:
The project budget will be selected from 2 options Ad hoc or monthly based.
The client will also provide a max budget for the project along with the delivery days. 
There will be 2 buttons cancel and save in the top right corner of the form.
Skills are added after clicking on the save button.

The job will be posted after clicking on the post button in the selected workspace.
The workspace will have 5 tabs as below:
•	Job posting 
•	Freelancers 
•	Jobs
•	Activity
•	Deliverable
*Job posting:*
It will display all the jobs posted with their budget timeline, skills, and description.
*Freelancers:*
This tab will list all proposals from the freelancers for the jobs posted.
And team tab will display all the hired freelancers working in that workspace. 
*Jobs:*
This tab will list all the freelancers against the job for which they are hired, with the time for that job, budget, and rating of the freelancer.
*Activity:*
Inactivity freelancers can collaborate by sharing messages and sending attachments to their teammates. 
*Deliverable:*
In this tab, all the deliverables will be listed against their respective job and the client will be able to approve or disapprove the sent deliverable.

!image-2022-09-02-18-40-20-573.png|width=200,height=183!

Summary: Setting up profiles for Admin , Seller and Buyer Frontend
Description:
After logging in User will be redirected to his respective Dashboard. 
•	The user will log in as a buyer or seller from the login page.
•	User will be able to view his profile from the button at the top right corner which will open up a drop-down menu in which a Profile button will be placed to view the profile. 
•	Initially the profile will be empty and the user can fill his profile data from the button named “ADD” against each section on the profile page. 

*On the seller profile page following basic information must be displayed.*
•	Seller image, name, statistics 
•	Below the image there should be a message button and next to it will be an edit button to edit the image and name.
•	Seller skills.
•	Seller services or expertise 
•	Seller Education
•	Templates 
•	GIGS
•	Work history (showing reviews as sellers)

*On the buyer profile page following basic information must be displayed.*
•	buyer image, name, statistics 
•	Below the image there should be a message button and next to it will be an edit button to edit the image and name.
•	Buyer skills.
•	Buyer services or expertise 
•	buyer education
•	Templates 
Work history (showing reviews as a buyer)

*There should be a switch profile option on the dropdown menu which will be opened after clicking on the profile Icon on the top right corner.*

The profile setting page will be accessed by the setting button on the sidebar of the client and buyer dashboard.
The profile setting page will be having 4 tabs named as follows.
•	Account
In account, the user will upload his basic biodata 
•	Notification
In the notification, the user will be able to enable or disable the notifications for this NYNX web portal. Furthermore users will also be able to connect to a google account, GitHub and slack accounts.
•	Billing
The user will add his billing and payment accounts such as master card or PayPal.
The user will also provide his billing address
•	Security
The user can change his password and activate or deactivate his account. 

*Admin panel :*

Admin panel will list all the user profiles, with the option to activate or deactivate any account.

Below is the design attached for the User Profile view page and Profile setting page respectively. 
 !image-2022-08-17-14-53-55-216.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2022-08-17-14-54-43-485.png|thumbnail!

*The user will be authenticated based on his selection while signing up.*
* Users can sign up as a Seller
* Users can sign up as a buyer.
Below is the design page for Sign up.
 !image-2022-08-17-14-07-24-313.png|thumbnail! 
*The user will provide his User name, password and Email for sign-up. After which user will receive email verification on his provided email.  *

* After Signing up, the user will be redirected to the login in page, where the user will enter his credentials and will be logged in.
Design of login page is as follow:
 !image-2022-08-17-14-08-45-237.png|thumbnail! 

* The user will be able to reset his password if he forgets. A link for the reset password page will be sent to the user's verified email.

forget password page design is below:
 !image-2022-08-17-14-11-03-245.png|thumbnail! 
Email verification page with resend button:
 !image-2022-08-17-14-09-54-448.png|thumbnail! 

* On clicking that link user will be redirected to the reset password page. where the password can be changed once saved user will again be redirected to the login page. and will receive an email that his/her password has been reset.
Reset password page design is as below:
 !image-2022-08-17-14-12-10-949.png|thumbnail! 
* On every page and while changing the password user will be able to see a link to the sign-in page so that at any stage user will be able to retreat back.

Summary: profile setting page and design layout .
Description:
This task is about designing a profile setting page for users. 
The user can be a client or seller.
This page involves 5 tabs which are as follows:

*1.Account:*
In this tab, it will enable users to change or update their basic information involving

* Full name 
* company name
* Contact phone
* Company site
* Country
* Time Zone 

*2. Notifications:*
it shall ask users for their input through check boxes involving 

* Notifications
* Billing Updates
* New Team Members
* Completed Projects
* Newsletters.

*3. Connected Accounts*
It will allow users to connect other accounts with this website like Google GitHub and Slack. 

*4. Billing & payments*
In billing user will have 2 options to link credit / Debit Cards and his PayPal account.
Users will be able to add methods and Edit or delete any method. 
Further, it will also ask the user to put his billing address which should also be editable.

*5. Security*
In this section user will be able to change his password, The checks for passwords should be the same as shown in Figma design.

*6. Deactivate Account* 
this section will allow the user to deactivate his account.

Below is the attached Figma design for the Profile settings page of the Client. It shall be followed

!image-2022-07-27-12-04-50-966.png|width=200,height=183!

*Design reset password page.*

* The page should appear after user clicks on forget password and it sends a link to the email provided by the user.
That link shall take user to reset password page.
* If the user enters the same password instead of new the error should appear to notify the user.

The design of the page should be in accordance to the below figure.



!image-2022-07-26-11-34-05-614.png|width=200,height=183!

This task is about creating GIG form pages.

As when free lancer will be completing his profile, Creating GIG is one of the main part.
 
GIG form will be including 5 Tabs which are illustrated as below :
# overview
# Pricing
# Gallery
# Requirements 
# Description

+*Overview tab:*+
It will include following input fields:
*  GIG title
* Category
* Project attributes 
* Search tags
The design of the form should be according to the figure below.
 !image-2022-07-25-11-43-37-476.png|thumbnail! 

*+Pricing+*
This form will have 3 tire which involves Basic , Standard and Premium. Following are the input fields in this form.
* Custom Title 
* Custom description
* Delivery days
* Number of Revisions 
* Number of Pages
* Source File
* Responsive Design
* Project Price
The design should be according to the figure below:
 !image-2022-07-25-11-50-10-499.png|thumbnail! 

*+Gallery+*

From gallery tab freelancer will be able to add project images for the GIG.
